channel.title: Trying to identify a half remembered indie game
channel.description:
Hi - hope I’m in the right channel for this, apologies if not.
I’ve lost a game and I’m hoping the massed knowledge here will help me find it. It’s a Microscope-like thing, but geographical rather than through time. You’d be building up a map of locations and factions and characters, some on half an index card made into a tent, some on a full index card with one half made into a tent. It was on a site with several other games - I remember white with red headings, and this one in the bottom right of two columns. It felt like a sole designer site rather than a big company.
I don’t think I imagined it. Does anyone else recognise this?

item.title: Trying to identify a half remembered indie game
item.dc:creator: @scopperil
item.description:
@scopperil wrote:

Oh that’s brilliant, thank you - that’s a bonus on top of what I came here looking for.

Read full topic
item.source: Trying to identify a half remembered indie game

item.title: Trying to identify a half remembered indie game
item.dc:creator: @RedMagus77
item.description:
@RedMagus77 wrote:

Looks like they’re also on itch.io at https://randylubin.itch.io/
Definitely looking forward to browsing their catalog, i’m surprised I haven’t run across their stuff before, but that’s what I love about this hobby!

Read full topic
item.source: Trying to identify a half remembered indie game

item.title: Trying to identify a half remembered indie game
item.dc:creator: @scopperil
item.description:
@scopperil wrote:

Wait I found it! Something about writing it out made google better.

It’s Panorama, at https://diegeticgames.com/

Read full topic
item.source: Trying to identify a half remembered indie game

item.title: Trying to identify a half remembered indie game

item.description:
@RedMagus77 wrote:

Not a clue, but that sounds pretty great and interactive. Hopefully it stirs someone’s memory!

Read full topic
